Cell.Data: <Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You find a Stormfall guard schedule on the ground. Spies planning an offensive on your domain? You reconsider your direct attack. Perhaps you might discover who they work for.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Further down the road, you find the ground hastily tampered with to conceal footprints. The effort caused a few strings of fibre to drop from the fugitive’s clothes, indicating the correct way.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Eventually you find a very clear set of tracks. Perhaps too clear… A heavy engine has been dragged along the path.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Drawn out into an open area, you find energy blasts being shot from overhead, barely missing you. There’s the heavy engine you were looking for.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Numb from the electric blasts of the previous battle, you seethe. They knew you were following them. They knew, and you followed them straight into a trap. You need to bounce back, but how?</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You allow exhaustion to take hold and drop to the ground. Anyone would think you were unconscious, but behind closed eyes you stay alert. Whoever your enemy is, they won’t be content with leaving you for dead. They’ll want to make sure. And when they draw near…</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You were meant to be alone during this hunt.. but when you turn around, you spot a figure standing some distance away in a Daybreaker’s armour. You bark questions at them, but they just walk straight past you. They inspect the same clues as you; a fellow tracker.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The Daybreaker is following you into dangers unknown. You leave a message behind, warning them of the enemies you’re facing. Whether they listen is up to them.</Font>
The Righteous and the Needy

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Your journey turns easy; suspiciously so. Hostiles in the area have concentrated elsewhere, judging by the warcry you overhear. You could use this opportunity to reach your goal but a twinge of guilt hits you at the thought. You can’t abandon the Daybreaker.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Your mark isn’t far ahead of you. His gait is heavy with valuables… but you’re led straight into a hunting band of cultists, who’ve had valuables of their own vanish and are positively peeved about it.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">In the hurry, your target drops a rolled up piece of vellum: they have an appointment with a convoy that’ll take them far out of your reach.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You can tell by the freshness of his tracks that your target is growing weak and winded, perhaps under the weight of all they’re carrying. This might just be the opportunity you need to grab them.</Font>

You stride towards a poorly hidden cache, when a mechanical click rings out under your foot. You’re barely able to bounce back, using your weapon to jam the trigger. Whatever they’re hiding here must be very interesting.
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You tease out the traps lain around the area using branches, and eventually find that what you thought was a single cache… was in fact an entire storage area!</Font>

You stride towards a poorly hidden cache, when a mechanical click rings out under your foot. You’re barely able to bounce back, using your weapon to jam the trigger. Whatever they’re hiding here must be very interesting.
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Your rivals were alerted by the trap going off, and are closing in on your position.</Font>

You stride towards a poorly hidden cache, when a mechanical click rings out under your foot. You’re barely able to bounce back, using your weapon to jam the trigger. Whatever they’re hiding here must be very interesting.
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Your search for caches bears no fruit. And yet, you’re certain there’s something here…</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Your search for caches bears no fruit. And yet, you’re certain there’s something here…</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Your search for caches bears no fruit. And yet, you’re certain there’s something here…</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Your search for caches bears no fruit. And yet, you’re certain there’s something here…</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">When you finally cross the barrage of traps in your way, you find an empty pit in the ground, freshly unearthed. What was buried here has already been spirited away. Perhaps if you can reach that cursed target of yours, you’ll be able to recoup your losses.</Font>

You stride towards a poorly hidden cache, when a mechanical click rings out under your foot. You’re barely able to bounce back, using your weapon to jam the trigger. Whatever they’re hiding here must be very interesting.
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You find yourself on top of a pressure plate when you approach. The sounds of machinery are unmistakable, but you can’t immediately tell what you’ve activated.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Figures of renown rarely venture beyond Stormfall’s walls: bandits and enemies of state alike are all too happy to find someone to ransom. You can bait these kidnappers with your own name, if you reach them.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The would-be kidnappers are caught aback by your attempt at surrender. They approach, weapon in hand, before assessing that your bounty would be served just as well if you were dead.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Figures of renown rarely venture beyond Stormfall’s walls: bandits and enemies of state alike are all too happy to find someone to ransom. You plan to bait these kidnappers with your own name, but you must reach them first.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Before attempting your false surrender, you assess the kidnappers’ tracks. Not only are they better armed and prepared than you’d expected, but you’re also struck by their lack of prisoners. Surrender would likely mean death.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You’d guessed that an organized enemy force might await in this area, but as a shadow flies overhead, looming large but escaping your sight, you wonder what arsenal your enemies have gathered against you.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You hear a nearby rustling but dismiss it at first… until a republican grabs you from behind and forces you to the ground. The end is near when an arrow suddenly splits their head. You look to its provenance and see a drake fly away.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You find the drakerider on a promontory. He deems you unworthy of working with the Order of Oshara. “For now,” he specifies.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The haughty drakerider lands near you again. “I would be remiss if I allowed you to injure yourself while I stood idly by. I will dispatch this quarry for you. Be nice and stay out of my way, won’t you?” You scoff, but go along with it. Help is help, and you’ll need every bit you can get.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">A piece of folded vellum paper lies on the ground. “You and I both have something to gain from each other. You have a bounty to collect, I want my boss out of the picture. Meet me at the designated spot.” It seems your target has a mole on their crew.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">At the designated meeting point, your contact negotiates for her share of the reward and gives you the location of your targets’ next stop.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You find a hiding spot, your contact sends a mirror signal, prompting you to leap into battle and slaughter her own “allies.”</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">A piece of folded vellum paper lies on the ground. “You and I both have something to gain from each other. You have a bounty to collect, I want my boss out of the picture. Meet me at the designated spot.” It seems your target has a mole on their crew.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">At the agreed meeting point, your contact negotiates for her share of the reward and gives you the location of your targets’ next stop.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Perhaps it was your fault for trusting a traitor: when you arrive, your contact uses a hand mirror to signal the beginning of your attack. You’re lured into the area just in time for enemies to surround you.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You almost lose your balance when a voice rings in your head: “He’s after me. If you don’t want him after you too, help me.” A psychic, calling for your aid? You call back to them in your mind. No answer.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The psychic soon speaks again, promising all matters of magic components if you save them.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The psychic’s messages turn distressed: they seem to be in imminent danger.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You rush; a psychic can easily be tainted by occult creatures. And sure enough, by the time you reach them, the traces of corruption are all over them and you’re forced to strike them dead.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Faced with an obstacle in your path, your pace slows just enough for danger to close in. The hair raises on your neck… and when you turn around the threat is gone. A sheathed dagger is all that remains, dropped on the ground.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You examine the weapon from your unseen stalker: it’s a Senate’s Imperatum. An Alastor has been contracted to assassinate you.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Knowing you have an Alastor after you, you race against the clock. If he catches you at a disadvantage, that will be the end of you. You’ll need utmost speed to prepare for this fight.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You glimpse the Alastor leaping ahead: just as you’ve been reevaluating your strategy, he’s been reevaluating his own. You’ll have to fight through him to reach your target.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You feel eyes on you. Not attacking, nor moving, nor really trying to hide themselves. Without meaning to, you shift your movement to avoid their gaze even as you realize that’s exactly what they want. Where are they directing you?</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">As you assess the enemy’s supplies, you look back and realize you’ve left a trail of red powder behind you. You must’ve walked through a trap: enemies are likely to be following you.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Even as you feel the enemy gambit tighten around you, you refuse to back away: you are no prey, but a hunter. They have toyed with you long enough; it’s time to reverse your fortunes.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You investigate various scorch marks and get a better idea of your target’s weaponry. The battle ahead will be harsh…</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You hear a resonant whistle, and the cracks of machinery. Someone’s preparing you a grand welcome.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You find some of those Republican supplements that circulate among fighting bands of all kinds. Consuming them, you feel a surge of brittle energy. You ought to ride it out while you still can.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You spot a unit moving ahead of you, in the direction of your quarry. Reinforcements? You barely have time to wonder before they spot you and bare their teeth, closing ranks around their leader.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You see large heavy tracks along the way… a carriage? A machine of some sort? The smell of gunpowder in the air sinks in: your enemies have stolen a cannon.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">A horde of enemies lies ahead of you. You take a breath and ready your weapons: it will take all the speed and momentum you can muster to move forward. You can’t let up for even a second if you intend to make it through.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The tracks on the ground are many… your target won’t be alone.</Font>

You study the dead creatures on the way to your goal. Doing so, you learn about your target’s fighting style, and what you learn is not good. They are stronger than you’d expected, a finer strategist than you’d hoped.

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You learn more about your prey by studying the print of their boots, whether they stand more heavily on the left than the right. Whoever they are, they’re heavily armed.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You find a freshly dug up cache: empty. Whatever equipment is here, it is now in your target’s possession and they will use it to face you.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">“Stormfall perishes in a fortnight.” You’ve heard this sentence repeated like a chorus in the past week, sparked by the reports of a doomsaying tracker. You could verify whether there’s any reality behind their premonition.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You spot a few Golden Scarabs crawling. These are often taken for omens of wealth. Was this what caused all the rumours in Stormfall? Trailing them, you find that they converge…</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The trail of scarabs mingles with other vermin.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The swarm of vermin merges into a wriggling mass. “Come… closer…” it growls. Then, something shatters in your mind, as it did for the trackers.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Abandoned vials and ritual components riddle the ground. Only one item calls out to you with anything other than hostility: a book closed with an ornate leather strap. For some reason, you can’t resist. Barely understanding your own actions, you stuff it into your pack.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You open the book you stole: the symbols inside are unfamiliar, yet instinctively, you know they speak of power. You know, because you feel that power flow through you.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Soon, the book’s power is not enough. You sense that this is where you will take your due. The power of the living things around will pass onto you thanks to the book.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You stand among the destruction you’ve wrought, and your conscience trickles back in. You didn’t master your power: it mastered you. But no more. Your occult adversary lies at the end of the path, and he is not one a mere puppet can dispatch.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You cross landmark after landmark into your mark’s domain. By passing through, you sense you’re silently consenting to a bond with the master of the domain, each threshold earning you more vigour. </Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">One threshold asks you to trade names with your bondmaster as a mark of fealty. You allow it.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Another threshold asks for your lifeforce to blend with that of your bondmaster. You allow it.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Your bondmaster requests that the limits between you and it be torn down. You allow it. Your essence blends with that of your quarry.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Something tugs at your mind while you explore the full depths of your power. Somewhere deep within, a part of you is resisting this loss of control, urging you to resist your bondmaster.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You were arrogant. You thought you could use the occult without letting it use you. But when all seems lost and your bondmaster readies himself to devour your consciousness, your bond to the Ascended burns him out like a fever. You open your eyes, back in control.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You pass by three bodies savaged with traces of the occult: a mother, a father, and a boy. You sense a strange connection with the dead. The boy was Ascended, you realize. Judging by their Republican garb, these were refugees fleeing to protect their child.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You can’t shake the dead Ascended boy from your mind. The sound of childlike laughter rises all around you.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The childlike laughter drowns out all thought. Worse, it begins to change. The laughter becomes forced, mutates into sobs and reverbs with an occult sound. A question comes to you: when the essence of an Ascended falls into the wrong hands, what becomes of it then?</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Memories of your distant childhood, before Heimlock took you in, come unbidden to your mind. You hear voices that are undeniably familiar yet you can’t put a name to. They multiply; a polyphony of madness.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The illusory image of an archway appears above you before vanishing, leaving you with a feeling of weakness and fatigue: you recognize that archway from your hometown as a child.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">A raucous chant collides with the voices of the past; you awaken from your nostalgic illusions to the sight of a ritual.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">With the ritual interrupted midway, your mind is still partially subjugated. You’re drawn towards your unholy quarry and you know intuitively that you’ll have to destroy it to free yourself.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The more you resist the call of memory, the more it dominates your mind. You take a gamble and allow yourself to fall into it. The recollection of those last days with your family gives you some inner peace and strength.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You knew fearsome enemies would await in this area, but as a shadow flies overhead, looming large, you begin to fear it was hubris for you to come here alone. Something lingers here beyond what you know of the supernatural.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You focus so much on finding cover from the reptilian shadow in the sky that you forget to keep the other lurkers at bay…</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Chills run up your spine as strange energies concentrate around you. Something is coming.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">An ice-cold hand rests on your shoulder; you dare not turn around. It begins gripping you. You hear the sound of a blade traversing flesh, and the grip slackens. You turn around to see a Knight of Oshara, standing victorious over your assailant.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You clear the ground and find it marked with these words: “Those who pass must pay the tithe; grant what peace you hold inside.” As you walk by it, whispers begin filling your mind and clouding your perception of reality.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">“Those who pass must pay the tithe; to those they’ve wronged and have deprived.”</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">“Those who pass must pay the tithe: spill your blood red & alive.” You offer your blood willingly.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">“Those who pass must pay the tithe: memories sweet of warm delight. These recollections once forgotten open your way to the night.” A memory of sparring with Valeria rises to the forefront of your mind, before disappearing forever as you pass the landmark.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Stormfall trackers speak of places where all sounds are drowned out, voices stolen from the speakers’ mouths. You recognize the fabled effects of the Abyss in those tales, and decide to investigate.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Whispers invade your mind. The rumours were true: something intrudes here from within the Abyss.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You find an effigy of you made of string and twigs: an invitation. But an invitation to what?</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The Abyssal disturbances increase in density the further you walk. Soon enough, you discover why: the air is cracking, and in the spaces between matter, the Abyss comes leaking in.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Weary, you close your eyes and find yourself walking through a Republican town wearing a Purifier’s armour. Edric waves at the end of the street. As he steps closer, his foot snaps a twig and the illusion ruptures.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Memories parasite your perception of the world. It becomes harder to progress with these old pains aching in your chest.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You can’t shut it out. You see Edric’s dead body thud against the ground. Again. Again. And again. </Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Your regrets circle around you. Edric pushes into your personal space: “You chose survival over principle. At least I died a man.” Valeria looks on, disgusted. “I sacrificed everything to stand by you. Was it worth it, {brother|sister}?” Finally, Heimlock unsheathes his blade. “I know your pain, child. The world will be better without us in it.”</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">These hunting grounds seem sick, perhaps even dead. As if embalmed to present the illusion of life. You feel perfectly alone. Home sounds like something you merely dreamed of once.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">For a moment, everything appears transparent and immaterial: you see the sky beyond your surroundings and feel yourself about to drown in infinity.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Suddenly, you see it: around Wolcen there are four planes wound around it like a tourniquet, slowly winding tighter until it is certain to crush you. Your vision transcends all.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You’re increasingly conscious that you are meat and only meat in the face of the larger universe. Your body feels fragile with that realization.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The weight of all that threatens you comes crashing down, and your mind can no longer handle the strain. You forcefully blank out all thought, looking inward to find peace.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Amid your torment, you find lucidity: the foes that made you feel so small, are just as insignificant as you are. You are inconsequential, but so is all that threatens you. That is an even fight.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You get too close to the landmark and a guff of cold wind bursts outwards at your approach. What just happened?!</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The entity you’re hunting isn’t here. You curse under your breath; every minute that passes, you can sense the effect of your targets rituals growing stronger.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The blood you shed on the battlefield seems to feed something. The floor thrums with horrendous delight.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You spy some blessed scarabs, no doubt summoned here to fulfil some demon’s desire for power. You’re no demon, but you could certainly use power if you were so inclined.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Vibrations rise up from the ground and rattle your bones: a ritual’s proceeding around you, threatening to break the barrier between reality and the Abyss.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The creatures you fought through on your way here were flooding towards this specific area; fodder for a greater enemy, perhaps?</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You find a component of ritual magic and remove it. Your mind clears; a curse had been scrambling your senses to keep you away from your target. This comes at a cost, and your target is now free to use all their magical energy on fighting.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The world of demons operates by rules and conventions unknown to men. Every breach of etiquette you make, every time you disrespect the Abyssal hierarchy, you feel their punishment bearing down on you.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">As you slip in and out of deafness, you realize the Abyss is leaking into the hunting grounds. Your enemies are growing stronger and better prepared each moment.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Among the enemies you cut down were some corrupt and possessed humans. This is nothing out of the ordinary for you, but within this profane area, those killings are accounted as human sacrifices. But for whose benefit? </Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You smell smoke: someone else is hunting here. Poachers, bandits, perhaps. These intruders might scare off your prey if you don’t dispose of them.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Traces of old blood and claw marks lie where a predator once dragged its prey. You follow on.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The behaviour among the monsters you’re fighting shifts slightly. They’re nervous. They’d rather not be here. Perhaps they’re intruding on some greater beast’s territory?</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">This place fits the description for your prey’s nest. By the smell, you’re almost certain of it. Something lurks at the periphery of your vision, eating the dregs of a once a plentiful carcass. Its eyes dart up… before disappearing.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You watch for traces of your quarry’s past hunts. It’s a picky eater, only partial to certain kinds of meat. An exploitable weakness, if you’re brave enough to pursue it.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You carve out a strip of fresh carcass, one that will be appetizing to your prey. This will serve as the base for your trap.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Next step in setting your trap is finding the right poison. It takes you awhile, but here at the base of this landmark, you find the lethal fungus you were seeking, growing on the edge of a puddle.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Your prey comes no closer to you. The smell of poison, you suspect, is too sharp. You drench the carcass in blood, hoping to conceal the hint of death that lurks within.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You toss your bait ahead, and wait…\n\n Something’s coming.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">A putrid mist forces its way into your lungs. Your prey’s territory is hostile; the very air seems to reject you. Others would stop here. Not you. You delve deep into your body’s supplies of air and wrap a cloth over your mouth and nose.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Your prey has a sharp ear. You adapt your step to the ground’s consistency, attempting to reduce the sounds of your progression.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">This domain is uncomfortable to navigate, colonized by legions of pesky beasts. But you’re gaining an instinct as to how to get around them, and find yourself progressing a little faster.</Font>
You evolve through your enemy’s territory as easily as you would through your own. This is a challenge to the kingly beast of this domain, and the challenge will be answered.

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Anyone entering the domain would believe the hunt was already over and done with. Blood is strewn over the scene around a carcass less than a day old. The creature put up a good fight: its teeth are covered in blood and recognizable pieces of skin: your prey is wounded, somewhere out there.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You find blood pooling by the landmark, traces of pus over it: your prey’s wound is infected.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You spot the behemoth you’ve been hunting: its lower abdomen is blackened. Its guts must have ruptured, causing the beginning of septic shock. You hear the roars ignited by its pain, vicious and loud. Knowing where to strike, you ready your weapons for a fight more furious than you could have ever dreamed of.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">It occurs to you that your prey is taking a strange path. Looking away from the trail, you see claw marks and small traces of blood. It makes sense now: your prey is trying to avoid another encounter with a worthy rival…</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You drop a cloth scented with your prey. Perhaps you can draw its enemies in: after all, aren’t the enemies of your enemies your friends?</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You hear something: a click, a purr, or perhaps a growl. You whip around with a burst of joyful bloodthirst, but when you look, you don’t find your prey. This is its challenger.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The unspeakable casualties behind you begin to make more sense as a shadow passes overhead, but the source escapes your sight. Some creature lingers here, and it is far beyond your purview.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">A shadow passes over the ground again. Your hand stops short of grabbing your weapons: you recognize the livery of the Order of Oshara before it disappears out the corner of your eye.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The Knight of Oshara approaches you. “I believe we might be hunting the same game,” he says, grinning. “My sponsor in the Order is expecting a hunting trophy from my trip; perhaps we could split the gains?”</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You hear a faint noise from your surroundings, some rustling and whispers indicating more people around. News of your precious target may have reached interested parties…</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Having fielded the bandit offensive, you seek the most shadowed corners of the area to avoid detection. It’s not perfect, but this path will be a modicum safer.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Inspired by the bandits’ garb, you camouflage yourself in mud in preparation for the fight ahead. You will use every dirty trick, every tool afforded by your environment in order to even the odds.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Bonecracks. Heavy breathing. Irregular steps. Your prey should be dead, but some inexorable determination is keeping it walking. You suspect magic plays a role.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You follow the traces of magic that keep your prey alive. They converge around a few containers.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">With the flow of spiritual energy interrupted, your prey has slowed down. Its broken bones pain it beyond endurance. However it might tower over you, you now have an edge.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The hunting grounds seem chaotic at first, but you detect a hierarchy as all the natural world unites to defend your prey. A buzzing sound ahead tells you the next deployment is coming: you ready your weapons.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The social structure of the creatures around you is crumbling. Taking out part of their hierarchy severely weakened their defences: what if you did so again?</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Weathering an infestation of Svriir, you determine that killing their leader will scatter them and will allow you to carve a way to your true target for good.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">If you turned this into a war of attrition, a much weaker adversary might wait at the end of your road. You choose to drag out the chase as long as possible.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You’re closing in on your prey… too close. It notices you and rushes ahead: the chase continues.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Exhaustion and thirst gnaw at you, but you find footprints indicating that the beast turned back on its tracks at the edge of its domain. It’s still within reach.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You push to the edge of your endurance, forcing your prey to up its speed as well.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Your prey rushes into a nook, where you hope to finally see its face and corner it. But it dashes past you in a blur as you reflexively raise your arms to defend yourself.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You’re coursing through the hunting grounds, when you hear a thud. Your prey fell: when it gets back up again, it’s considerably slower. You have an opening to catch up.</Font>
You’ve wandered too close to your quarry’s young. Judging by the groans ahead, it is furious.

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">In spite of its appearance, the landmark is possessed of a purifying aura which begins spoiling the poisons you carry. It’s not all bad though: if your prey was here, any venom it possesses must also have been weakened.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You set out a piece of bait, laced with a peculiar compound of Demetra’s making. This should nullify any venomous surprises once you meet your target.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You hear the scrounging of scarabs nearby. These creatures are scavengers, drawn out of their nests by fresh carcasses. Your enemies should fit that purpose just fine once you’re done with them.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">In spite of its appearance, the landmark is possessed of a purifying aura which begins spoiling the poisons you carry. It’s not all bad though: if your prey was here, any venom it possessed must also have been weakened.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You encounter a beast which, while hostile, expresses an unusual curiosity towards you. Perhaps you could turn it to your side.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You find a bloodied beartrap. The creature who triggered it is long gone, but any feats of agility will be made a lot more difficult for it.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Your quarry doesn’t do well in a chase: it has to focus all its strength on getting away from you. Once you reach it, you suspect it’ll have much less energy for fighting.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">From this vantage point, you’re briefly able to aim at your prey and hit it with a dart of Demetra’s making. The sleeping agent within ought to make the creature sluggish.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The air is unnaturally dry, making you thirsty. But on the positive side, your prey is thirsty too. You see prints indicating that the creature keeps staggering, even falling to the ground.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You’re swarmed by armed men on all sides. You’re forced to hold your position seeing no clear path ahead.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The ground crunches under your foot as you approach the landmark. The sound alerts your rivals, and they come rushing in on your position.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You find a sign which says: “Those who pass must pay the tithe; to those they’ve wronged and have deprived.” Before you can resolve its meaning, several figures appear before you… </Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">On your approach, you spot a few crates marked with Stormfall’s symbol. Nearby enemies seem intent on destroying them; rescuing the supplies might keep you in the city’s good graces.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You hear a faint noise from your surroundings, some rustling and whispers indicating more people around. News of your precious target has reached interested parties… </Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">A glint of yellow in the ground: a nest of scarabs lurks here…</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You find gold dust in the earth and lean down to touch it. When you raise your head, scarabs come spilling out of a nest.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You sense a string of energy that condenses here, within a set of containers. They look unstable, shaking with power. You ought to dispense with them immediately.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Here lie the abandoned belongings of hunters and travellers past. It may be disrespectful to scrounge through them, but no one’s alive enough to care around here.</Font>
Someone has been hoarding their victory spoils here, and they are plentiful. If you took a moment, you could gather up quite the hoard of your own.

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Your target is hungry and frazzled. But far from making them weaker, they cut ahead in an adrenaline fuelled rage, leaving the remains of hostiles for you to see.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You take a moment to catch your breath, hoping your target will lower its guard should you wait a little. Unfortunately, it seems to have regained vigour once the pursuit starts again.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">When seeking clues of your prey’s path, you find that it leaves swaths of slaughtered enemies in its wake, dispatched through speedy, insistent attacks that left no opening for retaliation.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You find evidence of a standoff between your target and a mysterious hostile. Your target was unshakeable, shrugging off attacks while remaining firmly in its stance. You expect the same from your upcoming fight.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The terrain is slowly becoming more favourable to your target, as you advance. Any attack it deploys on you will be especially efficient.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">You get a small nick on your forehead, which while harmless, does produce a significant amount of blood. Your enemies will attack with renewed viciousness.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Near the landmark, you find a small pool of water lightly troubled with dust; your target must’ve drank from it. You sense healing properties coming from the pool. It seems your quarry will be especially hale once you meet it.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The distance between you and your prey keeps growing: whatever this creature is, it’s faster than you by far.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">As you get closer to cornering your target, it grows panicked. You aren’t looking forward to fighting a frantic enemy, but perhaps you might get some tactical advantage out of it.</Font>
<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">Your prey doesn’t seem in a rush to outrun you. It’s confident, almost taunting you; as if none of your attacks would even make it flinch.</Font>

<Font Size="12" Color="#ccb270">The tracks come to an end, as blood pumps through your body. You’re just a minute away from the satisfaction of the hunt. You wonder when your quarry will reveal itself, steeling yourself in anticipation.\n\n…It is time. It is here.</Font>
